channel.title: Shops
channel.description:
What would be ideal shops for a server? What NPCs would fit the spot? Should shops be all in one location? And if-so, should the shopkeepers of the shops be arranged in a line, or scattered in that area?
This is a discussion about shops. What should shops be? What should shops have? Discuss!
If you have enough time, tell us items for the shops. Server owners would love to put your ideas into action automatically instead of seeing what items to add to the shop. ;)

item.title: Shops
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

[quote=“Jayden., post:8, topic:536094”][quote author=JavaTC link=topic=654903.msg4390162#msg4390162 date=1387170946]

In my opinion, grand exchange is always the best.

The grand exchange opens up too much room for abuse of it’s system. How do you think merchanting clans were able to hold Runescape’s economy by the balls?
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ponzi_scheme
[/quote]

Well, make it work properly as an exchange with fixed prices, and you’ll be fine.[/quote]
I’m talking about actual Runescape when it put the grand exchange was put in

It basically worked like this
Merchanting clan has spambots advertise their clan "Make mils in minutes"
Players join it, and buy whatever item the clan leader (and his friends) tells them in bulk
Supply goes down, demand goes up, therefore the price rises
At a peak, where the demand starts to go stead as people catch on the price rise, the leaders flood the market with the item, making their huge profit, and then tell the merchanting clan to sell.

The issue is that the leaders have massive amounts to spend (cash stacks upon cash stacks), and by the time the normal players get word, the prices have started to fall. Supply not only meets demand, but creates a surplus, making it impossible to sell for roughly 80% of the clan.

They promised a low risk, high return investment (an impossibility) in order to profit themselves.
Basically, they fucked over the economy to get more money themselves.

If you think comparing the grand exchange to the stock market is extreme, just look at how similar the grand exchange webpage from 2009 (or so) looked when compared with the Yahoo! Finances page from the same time.

Of course, servers are vastly smaller in comparison, and typically more regulated, though this doesn’t rule out the possibility of abuse.

Your discussion isn’t accurate. It depends on what the server is like. If it’s a pk server, then everything should be cheap and in one area. If it’s an economy server, then the other way around. It also depends on how the economy server is handled. Shops need to suit the server accordingly.

item.title: Shops
item.dc:creator: @Anval Anval
item.description:
@Anval wrote:

I’d recon to make is as economical as possible. Just put the simple necessities in the shops, such as up to like mirthril arrows in a range shop for example. Nothing to crazy in shops like rune. It make the game more fun to work towards, so that people will spend more time in-game. That and make sure the NPC drops are somewhat complete. And for the sake of god, don’t put the shops in a line. It’s horribly ugly. I’d prefer having shops in different building in a city, such as varrock or falador.
